Material used.Description: HEK293 cells were transfected with plasmids encoding wild-type or mutant LRRK2 proteins.

Readout description.Result Description: G2019S variant showed a 2.5-fold increase in kinase activity compared to wild-type.
R1441C variant exhibited 40% reduced kinase activity compared to wild-type.

Biological replicates.Description: Three independent biological replicates were performed.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was analyzed in triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type LRRK2-expressing cells were used as positive controls.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector-transfected cells were used as negative controls.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA with post-hoc Tukey's test was used.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Kinase activity within 10% of wild-type levels.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Kinase activity deviating by >30% from wild-type levels.

Material used.Material Name: Postmortem brain tissue from Parkinson's disease patients
Material used.Description: Brain tissue samples were collected from patients with confirmed Parkinson's disease and healthy controls.

Readout description.Result Description: G2019S variant showed increased phosphorylation of substrates in patient-derived tissues.
R1441C variant exhibited reduced phosphorylation in patient-derived tissues.

Biological replicates.Description: Five independent brain tissue samples were analyzed.

Technical replicates.Description: Each tissue sample was stained in duplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type brain tissue from healthy controls was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Non-specific antibody staining was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Chi-square test was used for categorical data.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Phosphorylation levels within 15% of control tissue.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Phosphorylation levels deviating by >35% from control tissue.
